answers.answer: you may wanna see a rheumatologist.  It could be auto immune.  Did anything in your life change suddenly before all of this happened?  Any accidents?  Sometimes high stress situations or major physical or emotional changes can trigger auto immune responses from what I have read.  You also may want to go back for many years and write down everything that you can think of even if you think it is irrelevant.  Chances are it is linked in some way.  I am sorry that you are going through this and I hope that you find a doctor that can help you.

Reading your post have you been tested for thyroid anti-bodies, ie for hashimotos, were the thyroid can swing from hyper to hypo, and cause all sorts off different symptoms.I would have a FT3, FT4, TSH, AND THYROID ANTI BODIES, tested,There sounds to be multiple endocrine systems affected, ie diabetes, and thyroid,I would personally be looking at them first and see if youve got the anti-bodies,against the thyroid.I  think thats were i would be starting first, as a lot off your symptoms could be caused by your endocrine system.Good luck, keep me posted.Nicola.

Yes, something extremely traumatic happened to me right before all this, I was brutally raped and went into shock and left everything I owned, including a business, and lived in my car for 3 months until my friends found me.  I was completely out of it as this sort of thing happened to me many times as a child and I swore it would NEVER happen to me again when I was an adult.  Then, my dog got eaten my a large dog at a park. that put me in the funny farm for a week, in a complete catatonic state.  Then, all this happened.  Now, I'm trying to go to college again, and don't know why I'm bothering, because, the way I feel, I'm not gonna be able to hold a job anyway, that's why I'm so desparate!   Thank you for the advice, I never thought of a rheumatologist!!  I WILL make an appointment.
Thanks for your comments, no, they didn't go that far with thyroid tests, but now that I know what to ask for, I will demand they give me those tests!!Everyone's posts are invaluable to me.   Thanks.

I am so sorry that you went through that.  That would def cause a lot of stress in your life and again I am so very sorry.  I also have a lot of strange symptoms and they have checked me from head to toe and nothing is coming back.  I am now seeing a rheumatologist.  I hope you get some answers.  Take care and God Bless.

Yeah, it did.  I'm in EMDR treatment for PTSD now.  It's helping.  I am going to take the advice on here, though, and see an Rheumatologist.  Everytime I have gone to an Endocrinologist, they only do thyroid and diabetes, I've been to 5 of them, and they just do the same tests over and over.  Cortisol, sugar, and thyroid.  It's getting really old, and I was about to give up!!Thanks for your info.

Our hearts go out to you and our prayers.  Many of us pray that the Lord Jesus heal all the emotional scars in your life.I thought of something as I was reading your post.  Yeast overload.  Nyastatin and a anti yeast diet might be helpful to you.  Yeast overload can cause all kinds of symptoms.  Just a thought.Praying for God's direction in your life.The Lord bless and keep,Kara

Rheumatologists will check you for auto immune things.  It is a start anyway.  Do not get discouraged if they do not find anything right away though.  Sometimes these things are tricky(actually most of the time).  We know our bodies best and know when thinga are just not right.

title: POSTED A WHILE AGO, NOW MORE SYMPTOMS, HELP.
